TITLE: How Geopolitics Is Complicating the Move to Clean Energy
SUMMARY: The fate of Indonesia’s unrivaled stocks of nickel — a critical mineral used to make batteries for electric vehicles — is caught in the conflict between the United States and China.

TITLE: China’s Nickel Plants in Indonesia Created Needed Jobs, Plus Pollution
SUMMARY: An influx of Chinese investment into nickel-processing on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi is sowing pollution while generating economic opportunity.

TITLE: Trouble in China Pushes Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Into Bear Market
SUMMARY: The Hang Seng Index has fallen more than 20 percent from its recent high, as investors grow more pessimistic about China’s post-pandemic recovery.

TITLE: The Outlook for the Economy Has Improved. And Yet.
SUMMARY: The prospects for a soft landing for the economy and the markets look better than they have in months. Our columnist is still worried.

TITLE: Credit Card Debt Hits New Peak as Some Borrowers Face Financial Strain
SUMMARY: Debt rose to more than $1 trillion in the second quarter, a report found — a sign of financial strain for some, even before student loan payments resume.

TITLE: As Student Loan Payments Resume, Gen X Struggles to Save for Old Age
SUMMARY: The end of the payment pause means Americans in this age group will once again have to juggle paying off debt while trying to save for older age.

TITLE: How Former Vanity Fair Employees Started Working at Standard Industries
SUMMARY: Technically, none. So why has Standard Industries hired several of them?

TITLE: Intelligence Agencies Warn Foreign Spies Are Targeting U.S. Space Companies
SUMMARY: U.S. officials say Chinese and Russian spy agencies are trying to steal technology from private American space companies and preparing cyberattacks that could disable satellites in a conflict.

TITLE: Interest Rate Jitters Sink the Giants of Tech
SUMMARY: Apple, Nvidia, Tesla and Microsoft are among the giants that have tumbled by at least 10 percent in the past month after powering a market rally earlier this year.

TITLE: Savoring and Saving: Cooking on Vacation
SUMMARY: Getting a vacation rental with a good kitchen is a must for many budget travelers and those who explore destinations through cooking.

TITLE: In China, More Single Female Home Buyers, Resisting Sexist Norms
SUMMARY: The housing market in China is in turmoil. But more and more women, facing a less equal society, are buying their own homes in search of security.

TITLE: China Evergrande, Giant Developer, Files for Bankruptcy
SUMMARY: The filing comes two years after the company defaulted on its debt, setting off defaults by smaller Chinese developers.

TITLE: U.S. Mortgage Rates Climb Above 7%, a 21-Year High
SUMMARY: The average 30-year fixed-rate mortgage has climbed above 7 percent, making it harder for buyers to afford homes, which are already in short supply.

TITLE: Can Affluence and Affordable Housing Coexist in Colorado’s Rockies?
SUMMARY: The outdoorsy lifestyle of Colorado mountain towns has become a magnet for the new remote-worker class, upending life for those already rooted there.

TITLE: Can’t Hear the Dialogue in Your Streaming Show? You’re Not Alone.
SUMMARY: Many of us stream shows and movies with the subtitles on all the time — and not because it’s cool.

TITLE: Why Hawaii Is Scrutinizing Hawaiian Electric in the Maui Fire
SUMMARY: The utility company’s share price has tumbled after lawsuits were filed seeking to hold it accountable for the blaze, which has killed more than 100 people.

TITLE: Michael Parkinson, Famous for Interviewing the Famous, Dies at 88
SUMMARY: A mainstay of British television, he was best known for a long-running BBC program that was called simply “Parkinson.”

TITLE: Paul Brodeur, Reporter Who Exposed the Hazards of Asbestos, Dies at 92
SUMMARY: In his long career at The New Yorker, he specialized in writing about this and other threats to people’s health, including chlorofluorocarbons.

TITLE: Pilot Dies After Medical Emergency on Flight From Miami to Chile
SUMMARY: The pilot, part of a three-member crew, died after the Latam Airlines flight made an emergency landing in Panama on Monday, the airline said.

TITLE: After Maui Wildfires, Will Tourism Help or Hurt?
SUMMARY: Residents and travelers are grappling with the propriety of visiting Maui, the epicenter of last week’s wildfires but an island heavily reliant on tourist dollars.

TITLE: Aldi to Buy 400 Winn-Dixie and Harveys Supermarket Stores
SUMMARY: The German supermarket chain said that it would convert some of the Winn-Dixie and Harveys stores acquired in the deal, which is expected to close in early 2024.

TITLE: Shell Company Seeks to Extend Deadline for Merger With Trump Media
SUMMARY: The merger has been delayed several times since it was announced in October 2021, but now faces a time crunch before a looming liquidation date.

TITLE: Why Wall Street is Gung-ho on the Housing Market
SUMMARY: Despite mortgage rates hitting multidecade highs and jitters in the bond market, demand for new homes is strong and prices are rising.

TITLE: Walmart Draws More Shoppers, Helping to Bolster the Economy
SUMMARY: The company raised its forecasts for revenue and profit this year, a sign that consumers, the engine of the U.S. economy, remain resilient.

TITLE: Driverless Car Gets Stuck in Wet Concrete in San Francisco
SUMMARY: Though driverless cars have not been blamed for any serious injuries or crashes in the city, they have been involved in several jarring episodes.

TITLE: What Alex Jones, Woody Allen and Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Share
SUMMARY: Skyhorse Publishing has built a reputation for taking on authors that other houses avoid. And its founder has helped Kennedy mount a bid for president.

TITLE: YouTube Ads May Have Led to Online Tracking of Children, Research Says
SUMMARY: YouTube’s advertising practices on kids’ channels could have resulted in companies tracking children across the web, a report said.

TITLE: Robert H. Giles, Newspaper Editor and Nieman Curator, Dies at 90
SUMMARY: He headed the journalism program at Harvard after overseeing Pulitzer Prize-winning coverage of the Kent State shootings and corruption in Michigan.

TITLE: New York City Bans TikTok on Government-Owned Devices
SUMMARY: The ban extends to some of the popular accounts run by the city.

TITLE: Kansas Newspaper Raid: Seized Items to Be Returned to Marion County Record
SUMMARY: The raid of the newspaper, The Marion County Record, has drawn condemnation from First Amendment advocates.

TITLE: Fed Officials Avoided a Victory Lap at July Meeting
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials raised interest rates at their July 26 meeting, and freshly released minutes showed they remained focused on inflation risks.

TITLE: New Union Leaders Take a Harder Line
SUMMARY: Pushed by angry members, unions representing actors, autoworkers and UPS employees are becoming increasingly assertive under new leadership.

SUMMARY: Climate change, inflation and global instability have thrust companies that sell insurance to insurers into the spotlight.

SUMMARY: The retailer’s quarterly sales fell, in part because of boycotts over Pride-themed displays, and it cut its forecast for the full year.

TITLE: Two American Tourists Caught Sleeping in the Eiffel Tower
SUMMARY: The two men posed no threat and were handed over to the police, officials said.

SUMMARY: Inflation fears have led to a sell-off in stocks and bonds in August as the markets fret the possibility of more interest-rate increases.

TITLE: China and Hong Kong Stocks Slump as Economic Gloom Spreads
SUMMARY: A string of worrying data has taken the fizz out of markets.

TITLE: $80 Billion Influx Has Helped Customer Service, I.R.S. Says
SUMMARY: Money from the Inflation Reduction Act has helped improve customer service, but the tax agency continues to face uncertainty over future funding.

TITLE: Intel Acquisition of Tower Semiconductor Is Scuttled by China
SUMMARY: Intel calls off its planned acquisition of Tower Semiconductor, an Israeli chip maker, after waiting in vain for 18 months for a review by Chinese regulators.

SUMMARY: The slowdown in price pressures comes as wages are rising at a record pace, which could lead to further increases in interest rates by the Bank of England.

TITLE: Lebanon Freezes Accounts of Riad Salameh
SUMMARY: The action comes days after a U.S.-led coalition accused Riad Salameh of decades of corruption to enrich himself at the expense of his country.

TITLE: Joan Meyer, Longtime Editor of a Besieged Newspaper, Dies at 98
SUMMARY: She collapsed a day after the police raided her home and the offices of The Marion County Record, a weekly paper in Kansas.

TITLE: Russia’s Interest Rate Hike Highlights Economic Struggle Amid Ukraine War
SUMMARY: With the third-largest interest rate increase in a decade to shore up the ruble, Moscow’s policymakers are pursuing the conflicting goals of paying for the war against Ukraine and taming inflation.

TITLE: Wall St. Weighs the Effect of Weaker China and Stronger U.S.
SUMMARY: Investors are worried about the Chinese economy teetering as well as signs that the U.S. economy may be growing too fast for inflation to moderate.

TITLE: On TikTok, Movie Critics Go By Any Other Name
SUMMARY: On MovieTok, reviewers can reach an audience of millions and earn tens of thousands of dollars per post. “Critics,” they say, are old news.

SUMMARY: The personalities of MovieTok are not critics in the traditional sense. But their upbeat videos earn them the devotion of movie lovers.

TITLE: Wendy McMahon Is Named CEO of CBS News
SUMMARY: Wendy McMahon was previously the co-head of CBS News and stations alongside Neeraj Khemlani, who stepped down on Sunday.

TITLE: Country Garden: Why Its Financial Crisis Poses a Risk to China
SUMMARY: Country Garden was China’s biggest real estate developer. Now it is staring down default, facing billions of dollars in losses and $200 billion in unpaid bills.

TITLE: A.I. Can’t Build a High-Rise, but It Can Speed Up the Job
SUMMARY: Developers are embracing artificial intelligence tools like drones, cameras, apps and robots, which can reduce the timelines and waste that have made construction increasingly costly.

TITLE: Report on Anti-Gay Slur Could Put Wisconsin News Site Out of Business
SUMMARY: When a north-central Wisconsin news site reported that a businessman had uttered a homophobic slur, he sued, claiming defamation. The legal bills are piling up.

TITLE: What China Isn’t Telling the World About Its Economy
SUMMARY: Beijing stopped releasing youth unemployment figures in its latest attempt to play down negative trends as growth stalls, and global concerns grow.

TITLE: Restaurant Workers With Narcan Are on the Front Lines of the Opioid Epidemic
SUMMARY: As fentanyl overdoses in public spaces spike, the lifesaving drug Narcan is being stocked by more and more bars and restaurants.

TITLE: First Solar Finds That Forced Labor Was Used in Its Malaysian Ops
SUMMARY: The company, First Solar, said an independent review had found that subcontractors used unethical recruitment tactics and withheld pay from workers.

TITLE: China Suspends Report on Youth Unemployment, Which Was at a Record High
SUMMARY: The Chinese government said it would no longer release monthly data about unemployment in young people, which had risen each month this year and reached 21.3 percent.

TITLE: Hawaiian Electric Draws Scrutiny in Search for What Sparked Maui Wildfire
SUMMARY: The main utility serving Hawaii did not pre-emptively shut off power before high winds reached Maui, and power lines fell in the windstorm.

TITLE: Prosecutors Detail Evidence Against Sam Bankman-Fried
SUMMARY: In a filing, prosecutors laid out the evidence they plan to use to convict the founder of the failed crypto exchange FTX, who faces trial in October.

TITLE: Roaring Back From Pandemic, Japan’s Economy Grows at 6% Rate
SUMMARY: The rapid expansion came as exports have risen and tourists have flooded the country. But a drop in domestic consumption worried economists.
